metadata.scenario: Customer support interaction about a billing issue

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a charge on my latest bill. I was charged $75, but my usual plan is only $50. I'm so confused!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! Thank you for contacting us. I can certainly help you with that. Can I please get your account number or the phone number associated with the account?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. One moment while I access your account details... Okay, I see the charge of $75. It appears there was a data overage last month. Did you happen to exceed your data limit?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, that's so frustrating! I wasn't even using my phone that much! How much data did I go over by?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: According to our records, you exceeded your data limit by 2 GB.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, but is there *anything* you can do? I've been a loyal customer for years. It just seems excessive to charge that much for going over a little bit.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me see if I can apply a one-time courtesy credit to your account to cover a portion of the overage fee. I can apply a $25 credit to your account. Would that be acceptable?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That would be amazing, thank you so much! I really appreciate it.
